text: Brigadier General Rezin Beall (1723–1809) was appointed commander of Maryland's Flying Camp militia by the United States Congress. ==Career== On 17 July 1776, Captain Beall was wounded in action on St. George Island, Maryland in a battle resisting efforts of British forces under the command of John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore to land on the mainland in Maryland. He is buried at St. John’s Episcopal Church in Beltsville, Maryland. Accessed 3 August 2016 ==References== Category:Continental Army officers from Maryland Category:People of colonial Maryland Category:1729 births Category:1809 deaths
title: Rezin Beall
